original_text: Wake up, Lord! Get ready to show your strength! Do great things, as you did in past days, when our ancestors were alive. Remember how you cut the monster, Rahab, into pieces. 51: ‘Rahab’ was a monster that lived in the sea. It is a picture of the enemies of God's people. See Psalm 89:10. Here it may mean Egypt. Wake up, Lord! Get ready to show your strength! Do great things, as you did in past days, when our ancestors were alive. Remember how you cut the monster, Rahab, into pieces. 51: ‘Rahab’ was a monster that lived in the sea. It is a picture of the enemies of God's people. See Psalm 89:10. Here it may mean Egypt. Wake up, Lord! Get ready to show your strength! Do great things, as you did in past days, when our ancestors were alive. Remember how you cut the monster, Rahab, into pieces. 51: ‘Rahab’ was a monster that lived in the sea. It is a picture of the enemies of God's people. See Psalm 89:10. Here it may mean Egypt. Wake up, Lord!
korean_text: 여호와의 팔이여 깨소서 깨소서 능력을 베푸소서 옛날 옛시대에 깨신 것 같이 하소서 라합을 저미시고 용을 찌르신 이가 어찌 주가 아니시며

sentences.original_text: Get ready to show your strength!
as you did in past days,
'Rahab' was a monster that lived in the sea.
It is a picture of the enemies of God's people.
